content: wool felted crochet slippers materials lion brand wool-ease roving origins 100% wool yarn must be 100% wool and non-superwash in order to felt additionally roving or yarn that isn t tightly twisted will felt better if using multiple colors for stripes/sole/border 1 skein per color is sufficient for this brand you will have a lot left over the final weight for one size small slipper unfelted is about 93g 3 75 mm crochet hook this is a smaller hook than recommended by the yarn listed above this was on purpose to get a tighter stitch to make felting easier abbreviations chain = chain st s = stitch es round s = round s double_crochet = double_crochet decrease = double_crochet decrease double_crochet two stitches together increase = increase 2 double_crochet in same st gauges 19 stitches and 9 row = 4 or 10 cm with 3 75 mm crochet hook notes color and pattern if you want to do stripes change colors every two row when working the top and/or back portion of the slipper hook size i used a smaller hook than recommended on the yarn label this was on purpose to get a tighter stitch to make felting easier yarn type yarn must be 100% wool and non-superwash to felt and the amount of time it takes to felt will vary depending on the yarn used additionally roving or yarn that isn t tightly twisted will felt better resources a video on how to crochet and construct slippers can be found at https //youtu be/dcrejkixxia si=kfaks_u8bc39zdbg sizing if using a different yarn than the one specified in the materials section above the best way to figure out sizing would be to crochet a small square with a few row of double_crochet measure it wash until it is the desired amount of felted and measure again you can use the ratio of pre-felted length/post-felted length to calculate the number of row your sole should be example size calculation i made a small square 12 chain wide and 6 row of double_crochet long see photos below pre felting 4 row was about 4 5cm after felting four row was about 3 cm my foot length/desired shoe length 24cm the equation to calculate how long the pre-felted slipper should be is pre-felting length/post-felting length *desired shoe length = pre-felted slipper length 4 5cm/3cm *24cm = 36cm and then to calculate how many row you will need to reach this length the equation is pre-felted slipper length/length of one pre-felted row = number of row 36cm/1 125cm = 32 row size chart the colors in the chart below correspond with the colors in the pattern follow the pattern according to the color of the size you want to make size pre felting length post felting length number of row for cm cm the sole s 36 24/24 5 32 women s 6/7 men s 4 5/5 5 m 38 25/26 33 women s 8/9 men s 6 5/7 5 l 40 26 5/27
